alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:10PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Madison, northern Franklin, northeastern Crawford and southern Washington Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 910 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southwest of Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area to 4 miles southwest of Wesley to 2 miles southwest of Strickler. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Mountainburg... Elkins... West Fork... Greenland... Winslow... Chester... St. Paul... Wesley... Saint Paul... Blackburn... Aurora... Boston... Devils Den State Park... Pettigrew... Brentwood... Japton... Lake Fort Smith... Strickler... Witter... Fern... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 33 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Arkansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Arkansas.
